title: How to Arrange a House Party As a Teenage Girl

steps.headline: Tell about ten to fifteen people about the party, and soon the word will spread.
steps.description: All in all, it's likely fifty to seventy people will show up if you don't contain the invitation.

steps.headline: Make sure all the good china/ornaments are stowed away safely, and that any rooms you don't want people in are locked
Make sure you have lots of food.
steps.description: Things that cater for all people; vegetarians, vegans, light eaters, heavy eaters etc.

steps.headline: Try to keep alcohol to a minimum, unless you want your friends being sick all over your carpet!
Keep your drinking to a bare minimum.
steps.description: You're the host, and losing control of yourself means losing control of the party. You won't be able to monitor what's going on in your house if you have too much to drink, and you don't want to force your friends to take on your responsibilities.

steps.headline: Play good music that everyone can enjoy, preferably what your friend group normally listens to.
steps.description: Nothing too heavy or too slow!

steps.headline: Be sociable!
steps.description: Keep yourself moving and talk to every one. If someone arrives that you don't know (friend of a friend, for example) try to get to know them a little better and if they are making a mess ask them to leave.

steps.headline: If something does, sadly, get broken, or someone makes a mess of a room, don't fret.
steps.description: If you get angry, or start chasing around after people with a broom, people will get sick of you. You can tidy up later!

steps.headline: If there aren't too many people, perhaps suggest a game of spin the bottle, dares, postman's knock or seven minutes in heaven.
steps.description: These games can be a lot of fun.

steps.headline: When the party dies down, and most of the people have left, there will definitely be a five or six people hanging around.
steps.description: Try to politely get rid of them, nothing more interesting is going to happen

steps.headline: Get straight to tidying as soon as the last guest leaves (not before!).
steps.description: Your parents will be coming back tomorrow night (or maybe tonight, depending on how long the party lasted). Get the bulk of it cleared away and then go to bed!

steps.headline: In the morning, have a tidying frenzy.
steps.description: Do one room at a time, and break that room into four manageable quarters- doing a bit at a time

steps.headline: Don't make it too tidy or your parents will be suspicious.

text: Planning Tell about ten to fifteen people about the party, and soon the word will spread. All in all, it's likely fifty to seventy people will show up if you don't contain the invitation. Make sure all the good china/ornaments are stowed away safely, and that any rooms you don't want people in are locked  Make sure you have lots of food. Things that cater for all people; vegetarians, vegans, light eaters, heavy eaters etc. Try to keep alcohol to a minimum, unless you want your friends being sick all over your carpet!  During the Party Keep your drinking to a bare minimum. You're the host, and losing control of yourself means losing control of the party. You won't be able to monitor what's going on in your house if you have too much to drink, and you don't want to force your friends to take on your responsibilities. Play good music that everyone can enjoy, preferably what your friend group normally listens to. Nothing too heavy or too slow! Be sociable! Keep yourself moving and talk to every one. If someone arrives that you don't know (friend of a friend, for example) try to get to know them a little better and if they are making a mess ask them to leave. If something does, sadly, get broken, or someone makes a mess of a room, don't fret. If you get angry, or start chasing around after people with a broom, people will get sick of you. You can tidy up later! If there aren't too many people, perhaps suggest a game of spin the bottle, dares, postman's knock or seven minutes in heaven. These games can be a lot of fun. When the party dies down, and most of the people have left, there will definitely be a five or six people hanging around. Try to politely get rid of them, nothing more interesting is going to happen After the party Get straight to tidying as soon as the last guest leaves (not before!). Your parents will be coming back tomorrow night (or maybe tonight, depending on how long the party lasted). Get the bulk of it cleared away and then go to bed! In the morning, have a tidying frenzy. Do one room at a time, and break that room into four manageable quarters- doing a bit at a time Don't make it too tidy or your parents will be suspicious.
